website_summaries.verdict: The release is crisp and smooth on this thumb trigger-style release.
pros: Designed with an ergonomic release motion
Can be clipped onto your D-ring and left until you need it
Cleaner motion than other thumb releases on the market
cons: This release is on the small side, making it feel a little awkward in larger hands

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Light-weight release. Easy to use and easy to slip into pocket when done shooting. Would be nice if had come with a wrench to adjust it or used a screw with a common hex wrench. It uses something smaller than 1.5mm. But the 360 swivel is handy. Release is smooth (to me), but I've only used one other type.
customer_reviews.author: Doug S

customer_reviews.title: Take off the velcro...
customer_reviews.text: This release is fantastic, and so much more convenient, comfortable, and sleek than any wristband caliper I've ever used. I know that some people swear they could never make the switch, but, now I can't imagine not shooting with this. The price is great too. Several others are going for twice as much, and they are not up to par with this release. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Shine

customer_reviews.title: Great little release
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, it feels and handles great. There's a small hex screw to adjust the sensitivity but as it is, it looks and feels fine. The only thing missing is a way to attach a lanyard. I guess I'll have to keep it attached to the d-loop.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice trigger, I've been using it for a long time and it seems sturdy, long lasting, and precise. Two drawbacks: one, I had to wrap the handle with rubber tape because the center joint hurts the fingers. Two, the trigger's design is a bit weird, as thumb has to be moved in the opposite direction to the one which should be natural. Anyways, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and will not easily rotate between my fingers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it for the 360 swivel action. Seems well made, however it's too small for my hand, and will not easily rotate between my fingers. Seems more like a kid version instead of an adult size. Made my bow string torque, and my arrows were slanted to the side, when sticking out of the target. Other than being too small seemed to work okay.
customer_reviews.author: Deer Hunter

customer_reviews.title: and I find it much easier and more fun to operate than traditional wrist releases
customer_reviews.text: I used to pitch and my shoulder is kind of weird. Wrist releases hurt my shoulder for whatever reason. This release gives me zero pain, and I find it much easier and more fun to operate than traditional wrist releases. Accuracy seems to be unaffected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter and it has helped her close her groups down to an inch at 20 yards. Not bad for an 11 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Meee

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My release stopped automatically closing in less than 100 shots.
customer_reviews.author: Omar S.

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This release is what I was looking for! Very easy to handle when using this release!
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Z.

customer_reviews.title: Tru ball....release
customer_reviews.text: First time shooting a non wrap release...I should have done this year's ago. Accuracy. Draw hold. Ease of use...awesome tool. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... after a while I got hang of it seems pretty solid good price
customer_reviews.text: Little smaller than my old one and my old one you had to pull back on it and this one you have to push forward took a little getting used to after a while I got hang of it seems pretty solid good price
customer_reviews.author: Ernest King

customer_reviews.title: This is the best, most accurate release I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Max Hunter 3 to replace the Max Hunter 3 I lost last year during a hunt. This is the best, most accurate release I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: ChemicalAnalysisSpecialist

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé wanted this one and I ordered it and now she wants to shoot all the time. This release is smooth and is a great product. I have big hands and it still works great for me
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: They absolutely LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my nephews for Christmas. They absolutely LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a friend
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a friend. But he seems happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel M.

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome release! It is super quiet, smooth, small, and it feels like it's really heavy duty. I highly recommend this release if you're into handheld releases
customer_reviews.author: jason bishop

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Hair trigger, when getting used to it prepare to send some arrows into the ground/sky. Keep thumb away until ready.
customer_reviews.author: Elisse B.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate release
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this release, these are junk, inconsistent and inaccurate!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Personally I love this release
customer_reviews.text: Not "completely silent" it is however extremely quiet there is no click noise either. Personally I love this release. I shoot competition open class.
customer_reviews.author: Dave cruz

customer_reviews.title: I got this because I didn't like the one that goes around your wrist didn't know ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I didn't like the one that goes around your wrist didn't know if I was going to like it but it's great because you can clip it on to your D ring & leave it , it's not strapped to your wrist!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey. But looks like it will last. Works very well, no complaints with functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Nexus 7

customer_reviews.title: Great Release
customer_reviews.text: I really like this release. It’s small enough and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good release
customer_reviews.text: Not the most expensive release but works very well just as good as the 100$ releases truball has on the market
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Come on...this thing sells itself...my words are useless here, as any real archer would most definitely understand this solid fact.
customer_reviews.author: JHS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent release for the money. Love having it on the D loop while in the stand.
customer_reviews.author: John Konderwich

customer_reviews.title: New to me
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time to try a release like this. It has helped my groups and at very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome release
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few shots to get the feel for this release but now I enjoy it. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: James D Hess

customer_reviews.title: its an okay release
customer_reviews.text: consider buying one the only problem is it doesnt always close if you press the thumb release hard its okay tho all you have to do is press it again but its an okay release
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: ... and lock tight the adjust screw this is a great release!
customer_reviews.text: As long as u oil the calipers and lock tight the adjust screw this is a great release!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Lasyone

customer_reviews.title: Need more ajustments
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It fits well in my hand. I use it for bolth my hunting and my target bow. I just wish it was more adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my dad and despite some minor issues, he loves it. He is not finding his kisser/anchor point the same as his older release and he finds himself pulling his shots one way or the other..... But he is getting better with each use, so once he finds his groove he'll be on point
customer_reviews.author: Jovan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good release can't wait to use it hunting this season. Worked good while target shooting with my bow.
customer_reviews.author: Scottie Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Company shipps quickly to bad it's a bad product
customer_reviews.text: Releases prematurely and is dangerous. Will not hold a string from a 60lb bow. Company shipps quickly to bad it's a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Zethraeus

customer_reviews.title: Extremely ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: I like the thumb trigger on this release. The other one I tried had a cylinder you have to pull with your thumb, a very unnatural movement. The this release you just press down. It has a crisp release and I'm quite happy with it. The construction is excellent and it's very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Porter

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for me I had the adjustable screw slowly come loose and screw up the tension on the release.I tried to adjust as per instructions and I even used some loc tight but issue contined.I might have purchased a bad one I had to return it and Amazon did great job with the return.
customer_reviews.author: heli a angarita

customer_reviews.title: Have to say I am very disappointed in this release
customer_reviews.text: Have to say I am very disappointed in this release. It failed on me after maybe 20 shots. When it failed I ended up with a severely bruised and swolen hand and the arrow took an unsafe path through a neighbors yard. Not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: James R Bender

customer_reviews.title: in the loop
customer_reviews.text: wanted to try one, got a good price,tried it, works great for me. Stays on the loop instead of my wrist, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry upstate NY

customer_reviews.title: Great little release. Perfect for hunting
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic release. Allows for longer draw length. Maintains tension and is smooth release. Lightweight yet strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kevinw

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic release!!
customer_reviews.text: Release was in perfect condition when received, and works absolutely fantastic! Much easier to use than a normal release that you have to pull your thumb back on! A much steadier and cleaner release, and in a group of seven arrows that were shot at 10 yards, I "Robin Hooded " two of them!
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Love this release.
customer_reviews.text: I love this release, just bought this one because I lost my old one that was the older model of this one. Well worth the money if you like T handle releases. I use mine for hunting and 3D shooting it works perfect for bothj
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Target Jerk will happen
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hated this release. The forward tension causes a lot of jerk upon release. If this is your first thumb release, I would highly recommend trying something different!!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Gould

customer_reviews.title: Bad trigger!
customer_reviews.text: Trigger adjustment very tricky. Will fire unexpectantly. B carefull. Sending back!
customer_reviews.author: "Mb308"

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Could not judge the size when ordered , too small for my fingers, so cannot use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: The idea sounded really good to me, I thought it would be user friendly verses other back tension releases, however I believe it still requires a strong committement to learn to use it right. I decided to stay with my caliper - triger release.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: didn't work out of the box and adjustments are not ...
customer_reviews.text: didn't work out of the box and adjustments are not that simple. doesn't use standard allen key. sitting in my bag as a backup unfortunatelry
customer_reviews.author: neil.a

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for me
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for me. Well made unit. I had to add a drop of blue LocTite to the adjustment screw.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Holloman

product_meta.title: Tru Ball Max Hunter Release 3
product_meta.description: The Max Hunter has maximum draw length. A smaller head and smaller jaws for more draw length and more bow speed. It's completely quiet when loading. Activate trigger to open jaws. Let up on trigger to close them.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
